fac e bobble ok c om/ aunt je nny hat s page 2 the sharpened pencil scarf crochet abbreviations & definitions bpdc back post double_crochet fpdc front post double_crochet chain s chain s double_crochet double_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet single_crochet single_crochet decrease single_crochet two together slp st slip_stitch space s space s st s stich es * work instructions following as many more times as indicated work enclosed instructions as many times as specified by the number immediately following or contains explanatory remarks colon the number s given after a colon at the end of a row or round denotes the number of stiches or spaces you should have on that row/round post this is the vertical part of the crochet stitch join to join with a slp st unless another stitch is specified finish off this means to cut the yarn leaving 4-6 yarn to weave in later then pull /bind off the cut end of the yarn though the last loop on the hook to prevent the work from unraveling introduction this scarf pattern is worked flat starting with the pencil lead and ending with the eraser user must be familiar with color changing and carrying yarn techniques to successfully complete this scarf fig 1 pencil tip with zig-zag fig 2 metal clamp & eraser 2 01 7 ht t ps / / w ww fac e bobble ok c om/ aunt je nny hat s page 3 the sharpened pencil scarf
